definition[0]: if a group of people huddle together, they stay very close to each other, especially because they are cold or frightened
example[0]: We lay huddled together for warmth.
example[1]: People huddled around the radio, waiting for news.
definition[1]: to lie or sit with your arms and legs close to your body because you are cold or frightened
example[3]: The snow blew against his huddled body.
definition[2]: to sit or stand with a small group of people in order to discuss something privately
example[4]: The executive board huddled to discuss the issue.
definition[3]: if American football players huddle, they gather around one player who tells them the plan for the next part of the game
definition[4]: a group of people or things that are close together, but not arranged in any particular order, pattern, or system
example[6]: Huddles of men stood around talking.
definition[5]: a group of players in American football who gather around one player who tells them the plan for the next part of the game
